\\: <%GTREE 2 content section of the OIMS selfdescribing metadata schema%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: First element in any OIMS file that indicates that it is an OIMS file

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.0.2 OIMS_Header%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: header section of an OIMS compatible metadata schema

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.0.3 OIMS_Content%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: Description of the content of the metadata file
Section describing metadata fields

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.1 attribute \ [comment]%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: comment field

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.2 attribute AttributeName %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: name of the data dictionary metadata field

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.3 attribute AttributeDescription %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: description of the data dictionary metadata field

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.4 attribute DataType %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: datatypes used in the data dictionary metadata fields

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: An indication of the form that a value will have.

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.5 attribute Status %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: see OIMS self describing metadata schema

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: If the metadata field is required at all times

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: An indication as to whether entity is mandatory

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: If the metadata field is recommended but not strictly required
metadata field can be used if the information is available

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: possible but not necessary; left to choice

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.6 attribute TypeClass %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: if the attribute is compound or primitive

Controlledvocabulary.ControlledVocabularyItemDescription: the attribute does not have underlying attributes

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.7 attribute Multiple %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: can the attribute have multiple values

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.8 attribute ControlledVocabulary %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: controlled vocabulary definition if data type is controlled vocabulary also known as an enumeration in STATA or a factor in R

OntologyTerm.OntologyTermDescription: A set of terms that are selected and defined based on the requirements set out by the user group, usually a set of vocabulary is chosen to promote consistency across data collection projects.

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.8.1  Vocabulary element name%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: the element identifier in a controlled vocabulary

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.8.2  Vocabulary element description%>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: the description of an element in a controlled vocabulary in human-intelligible terms

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.9 attribute AttributeValueElements %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: description of the field compound used to identify the fields in a compound

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.10 attribute Ontology %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: Tagging atributes with ontology terms
term in an ontology that describes the relevant attribute value
Description of the ontology term
the name of the ontology from which we take the ontology term
the identifier for the ontology term in the specified ontology
persistent URL where the ontology term can be found
identifies to what degree the ontology term matches the attribute value

ControlledVocabulary.VocabularyElementDescription: the ontology terms matches the attribute exactly
the ontology term covers the attribute, but the attribute is more specific than the ontology term
the ontology term covers only part of the attribute, the attribute is broader than the ontology term
the ontology term needs to be confirmed by an ontology expert
unknown if it is an exact match, too general or too specific

MetadataMetadata.\\: <%GTREE 2.11 metadata heading section %>
MetadataMetadata.AttributeDescription: metadata heading section
